title: Catedral Metropolitana
address: 8a Calle y 7a Avenida, Zona 1, Guatemala City
description: Built in the late 18th century, the Metropolitan Cathedral is one of Guatemala City’s most iconic landmarks and a center of Catholic worship.

title: Palacio Nacional de la Cultura
address: 6a Calle y 6a Avenida, Zona 1, Guatemala City
description: Known as the ‘Green Palace,’ this historic building served as a presidential palace and now hosts cultural events and exhibitions.

title: Plaza de la Constitución (Parque Central)
description: The central square of Guatemala City, surrounded by historic buildings, is a popular gathering place for locals and visitors alike.

title: Mercado Central
address: 8a Avenida y 8a Calle, Zona 1, Guatemala City
description: A bustling marketplace where visitors can shop for crafts, textiles, fresh produce, and traditional Guatemalan cuisine.

title: Museo Nacional de Arqueología y Etnología
address: 6a Calle y 7a Avenida, Finca La Aurora, Zona 13, Guatemala City
description: This museum preserves Mayan artifacts, including ceramics, sculptures, and stelae, offering insight into Guatemala’s ancient history.

title: Kaminaljuyú Archaeological Site
description: One of the most important pre-Columbian Mayan sites in the valley, with ruins that date back over 2,000 years.

title: Mapa en Relieve
description: A giant outdoor relief map built in 1905, showcasing the geography and topography of Guatemala in remarkable detail.

title: La Aurora Zoo
description: One of the largest and most modern zoos in Central America, home to native and exotic animals from around the world.
